subject: Football
lead_paragraph: Greg Paulus, the former Duke basketball player who transferred to Syracuse in July to play football, has been named the starting quarterback for the Orange. Coach Doug Marrone announced the decision in a news release. Paulus played four years for Duke. He has not played football since high school, when he was a highly rated quarterback before deciding to focus on basketball. He beat out the sophomore Ryan Nassib and the senior Cam Dantley, who was Syracuse’s starting quarterback last season. Syracuse’s first game is Sept. 5 against Minnesota.
